intro: Aethionema diastrophis, commonly known as the rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual or biennial plant that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a grayish-green color and a slightly hairy texture. Aethionema diastrophis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
